p: Reindeer grazing can mitigate the effects of climate change, especially in tundra. Reindeer grazing can protect the tundra biome from shrubification and tree line encroachment [ 68, 83] . Incentive grazing in summer increases surface albedo, delays snowmelt and decreases the ground from heating in snowmelt season [ 84••]. Reindeer in fact is a key species for the environment and Saami inhabiting the area.
